intro: Limnetis glomerata, commonly known as the clustered water lily, is a aquatic plant native to freshwater habitats in tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its broad, floating leaves that form a dense canopy on the water surface. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warm season. Its roots anchor in the muddy substrate, while its stems and leaves are adapted for buoyancy. Limnetis glomerata plays a vital role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and shelter for various aquatic organisms.
